snippet.textDisplay:
Why does everyone make bad remakes of my favorite games? Resident Evil 2 and Final Fantasy VII. Next they will go after my third, fourth, and fifth favorite game's of Final Fantasy Tactics, Saga Frontier, and Castlevania: Sympathy of the Night and make remakes ruining those games as well.

This game would of been good if their voices were not so patheticly terrible, the swearing was bleeped like it was in the original that way you know they are human, and the storyline was in sincronization as relatable with real life commonality of the struggles of today's hardships. Then it would have potential.
snippet.textOriginal:
Why does everyone make bad remakes of my favorite games? Resident Evil 2 and Final Fantasy VII. Next they will go after my third, fourth, and fifth favorite game's of Final Fantasy Tactics, Saga Frontier, and Castlevania: Sympathy of the Night and make remakes ruining those games as well. 

This game would of been good if their voices were not so patheticly terrible, the swearing was bleeped like it was in the original that way you know they are human, and the storyline was in sincronization as relatable with real life commonality of the struggles of today's hardships. Then it would have potential.

snippet.textDisplay:
“He shall appear from a far eastern land across the sea,
A young man who has yet to know his potential,
This potential is a power that could either destroy him or realize his will,
His courage shall determine his fate,
The path he must traverse, fraught with adversity, I await whilst praying,
For this destiny predetermined since ancient times,
A pitch black night unfolds with the morning star as its only light,
And thus the saga… Begins… AGAIN!”
snippet.textOriginal:
“He shall appear from a far eastern land across the sea,
A young man who has yet to know his potential,
This potential is a power that could either destroy him or realize his will,
His courage shall determine his fate,
The path he must traverse, fraught with adversity, I await whilst praying,
For this destiny predetermined since ancient times,
A pitch black night unfolds with the morning star as its only light,
And thus the saga… Begins… AGAIN!”

snippet.textDisplay: There was a youtube comment a few years ago that I got into an argument with on how they should remake the game. “He” wanted a shinier version of the original like FF8. I’m genuinely glad they are going this route with a game so big, yet can be expanded upon to make even bigger (if the new characters and bosses are anything to go off of). This opening cinematic is almost exactly the same as the original but also longer and probably better. Details of the world, show off of the technology and beautiful score. Never managed to get my hands on the original but I hope to have a similar experience to what the older folks had with this new one.
snippet.textOriginal: There was a youtube comment a few years ago that I got into an argument with on how they should remake the game. “He” wanted a shinier version of the original like FF8. I’m genuinely glad they are going this route with a game so big, yet can be expanded upon to make even bigger (if the new characters and bosses are anything to go off of). This opening cinematic is almost exactly the same as the original but also longer and probably better. Details of the world, show off of the technology and beautiful score. Never managed to get my hands on the original but I hope to have a similar experience to what the older folks had with this new one.

snippet.textDisplay: This should have been priority over Kingdom Hearts 3 and Final Fantasy XV! I am glad SE scrapped Cyberconnect2's failure and moved the project in-house, the only place it should have ever been! I cannot wait until my auto-download begins 12am April 10, 2020! I'm not even disappointed that this is only FFVII:R Episode One, and am looking forward to the rest of the installments.
snippet.textOriginal: This should have been priority over Kingdom Hearts 3 and Final Fantasy XV! I am glad SE scrapped Cyberconnect2's failure and moved the project in-house, the only place it should have ever been! I cannot wait until my auto-download begins 12am April 10, 2020! I'm not even disappointed that this is only FFVII:R Episode One, and am looking forward to the rest of the installments.

snippet.textDisplay: As someone who has never played FF7... or any Final Fantasy game for that matter... I'm unreasonably excited for this one, just watching actual FF7 fans react with glee and absolute joy is enough to make me appreciate everything about this even more.

snippet.textDisplay: I was skeptical when they announced this years ago, remakes, be they movies or games, had a tendency to suck, or be inferior to the original. But this, man, every tease and demo they've put out has gotten me more and more invested and hyped for this. And this opening movie just solidified it. I'm officially on board, and there ain't no gettin' off this train.
snippet.textOriginal: I was skeptical when they announced this years ago, remakes, be they movies or games, had a tendency to suck, or be inferior to the original. But this, man, every tease and demo they've put out has gotten me more and more invested and hyped for this. And this opening movie just solidified it. I'm officially on board, and there ain't no gettin' off this train.

snippet.textDisplay: Can some one medically induce a coma on me for 54 days?
snippet.textOriginal: Can some one medically induce a coma on me for 54 days?

snippet.textDisplay:
MY GUY BADMAN BARRETUS 💪


I finally get to finish this game after playing the original way back in 97/98 and not getting to finish it. I think I got about halfway through the first disc, and I remember watching my friend (that introduced me to RPG games and loaned me FF7) struggle with that Emerald Weapon.

I'm contemplating whether to book a week off work but they could end up having to move the release again ......
snippet.textOriginal:
MY GUY BADMAN BARRETUS 💪 


I finally get to finish this game after playing the original way back in 97/98 and not getting to finish it. I think I got about halfway through the first disc, and I remember watching my friend (that introduced me to RPG games and loaned me FF7) struggle with that Emerald Weapon.

I'm contemplating whether to book a week off work but they could end up having to move the release again ......

snippet.textDisplay: Up until yesterday I never realized Aerith/Aeris is not standing in front of a chimney fire in the opening. I've always had that impression and never realized it's meant to be in a back alley…

snippet.textDisplay:
I've pre-ordered this game, and also, this game looks BEAUTIFUL!
These remakes/remasters is how it revolutionized into classic games being remade into modern graphics of now.
Crash Bandicoot N-Sane Trilogy is the prime example on how these remakes should be done.
Capcom is also following the footsteps on how these remakes are gonna be done, while Rare and Microsoft are sitting on a gold mine with Banjo-Kazooie, in desperation in being remade like this.
Anyway, I can't wait for this game
snippet.textOriginal:
I've pre-ordered this game, and also, this game looks BEAUTIFUL!
These remakes/remasters is how it revolutionized into classic games being remade into modern graphics of now.

Capcom is also following the footsteps on how these remakes are gonna be done, while Rare and Microsoft are sitting on a gold mine with Banjo-Kazooie, in desperation in being remade like this.
Anyway, I can't wait for this game
